# UX Laws Quick Reference Card

> One-line summaries of all UX laws for quick reference

---

## Decision & Cognitive Load

| Law | Summary |
|-----|---------|
| **Hick's Law** | More choices = longer decision time |
| **Miller's Law** | Working memory holds ~7 items |
| **Tesler's Law** | Complexity must exist somewhere—shift to system |
| **Occam's Razor** | Simplest solution is usually best |

---

## Perception & Attention

| Law | Summary |
|-----|---------|
| **Von Restorff** | Different items are remembered best |
| **Selective Attention** | Users focus on specific things, filter out others |
| **Serial Position** | First/last items remembered best |
| **Peak-End Rule** | Experiences judged by peak and end moments |

---

## Visual Organization (Gestalt)

| Law | Summary |
|-----|---------|
| **Proximity** | Near objects are perceived as groups |
| **Common Region** | Elements in same boundary are grouped |
| **Similarity** | Similar objects are perceived as related |
| **Uniform Connectedness** | Connected elements are more related |
| **Prägnanz** | Complex images = simplest interpretation |

---

## Interaction & Performance

| Law | Summary |
|-----|---------|
| **Fitts's Law** | Bigger + closer targets = faster acquisition |
| **Doherty Threshold** | <400ms response keeps productivity high |
| **Goal-Gradient** | Motivation increases near goal completion |

---

## User Expectations

| Law | Summary |
|-----|---------|
| **Jakob's Law** | Users expect your site to work like others |
| **Mental Models** | Users have beliefs about how things work |
| **Postel's Law** | Accept flexible input, provide consistent output |

---

## Memory & Completion

| Law | Summary |
|-----|---------|
| **Zeigarnik Effect** | Incomplete tasks remembered better |
| **Working Memory** | Users hold limited info at once |
| **Chunking** | Break content into small pieces |

---

## Aesthetics & Trust

| Law | Summary |
|-----|---------|
| **Aesthetic-Usability** | Beautiful = perceived as more usable |
| **Flow** | Optimal engagement when challenge matches skill |

---

## Staylook Alignment

| UX Law | Staylook Implementation |
|--------|------------------------|
| Von Restorff | "One Highlight" rule |
| Hick's Law | Single primary action/screen |
| Fitts's Law | Pill buttons maximize touch target |
| Proximity | 4px spacing grid |
| Common Region | Radius hierarchy (32→24→16) |
| Similarity | Consistent button shapes |
| Aesthetic-Usability | Premium curved aesthetic |
| Serial Position | Primary actions at end (right) |
| Doherty Threshold | 150ms/300ms/500ms animation scale |
| Jakob's Law | Familiar patterns + aesthetic innovation |

---

*UX Laws Quick Reference — Laws of UX*
